body.description: Classic letter stationery in our Ecruwhite Kid Finish. Crane’s Ecruwhite letter stationery has a timeless look. This is the kind of basic stationery that you should keep a stock of on hand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality Writing Paper
reviews.reviewText: Substantial, textured, high-quality writing paper for sending a personalized note on those rare occasions when e-mail just won't do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good looking stationary with a nice feel
reviews.reviewText: To be honest I haven’t used it yet, but I’m really looking forward to it. It has a nice hand feel and a creamy color that makes me happy every time I see it there on my bookcase—it makes me feel like I’m going to write someone a killer letter soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I wanted to write an important letter
reviews.reviewText: I had an important letter that I needed to write by hand. This paper was perfect. It looks and feels high quality. While it is thick, I was also able to put it on a legal pad and see through enough to follow the lines for my writing. I use a fountain pen and the inks I have tried have not bled through. I could write on both sides if I chose to.The complaint about the Crane logo is overblown. It appears on one side of each sheet of paper at the bottom in a light color and small font. I doubt I would have noticed except I was concerned and looking for it after reading the comment in a recent review. It is very unobtrusive, don't worry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, classy stationery
reviews.reviewText: This is really nice for letter writing. The paper is thick and has the "Crane & Co" emblem at the bottom of it. I use a medium nib fountain pen writing on it, and have had no problems at all with bleed through, even using a very dark black ink. A letter written on this has a very nice look and feel to it. I'll definitely be ordering more of this when I get low.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars The best stationary, but a marketing fail.
reviews.reviewText: While admitting that this is a first-world problem, I almost returned this box of stationery! I have used Crane for decades because of its elegance and quality. It was unquestionably 5-star quality and remains so. Even when I couldn't really afford it, I would buy the smallest package and use it only for very special occasions. A truly high quality product doesn't call attention to itself. Clothes with designer names on them look cheap, and say "Hey, look at me. I'm advertising ----." I am distressed that Crane & Co. now seems to want me do the same. I won't send this box back, but I will try to find a different high quality stationery for future use. I'll probably use this box a little more freely, just to be able to move on. I hope that by adding this review to the chorus of others with the same complaint, Crane & Co. will be moved to reconsider this marketing strategy. Even better, maybe they will see that there is a market for people who love their stationery, but without their name on every sheet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So much better then any other stationery
reviews.reviewText: The stationary is perfect for last minute thank you notes or for meaningful personal letters. The unusual size makes any note or letter more impactful and memorable. The heavier weight shows that the writer truly cares about presentation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality paper
reviews.reviewText: This paper is being used to send special notes, i.e., congratulations letters, condolence letters, etc. Very nice quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice thick, quality writing paper -- classic and timeless
reviews.reviewText: Nice thick, quality writing paper -- classic and timeless. The paper is thick and has a nice color and texture.I wish it didn't have 'Crane & Co.' printed and watermarked on the sheets and embossed on the envelopes. I am not particularly interested in advertising for Crane. The printing on the sheets strikes me especially egregious, as it lacks the subtlety of a watermark or the refinement of embossing.
